title: So That Bard W...
body:
...we ever gonna buff that or...?

It instantly falls off after level 6 or a turret falls. I want to like Bard, but I feel like he has one less ability than every other champ once the game gets heated.

replies.body:
TLDR: Yes.

We've got some changes to Bard planned for 5.17. Those currently look like this:

Caretaker's Shrine (W)
    Cost :: 100 / 105 / 110 / 115 / 120 >>> 90

Magical Journey (E)
    Cooldown :: 20 / 19 / 18 / 17 / 16 >>> 18 / 17 / 16 / 15 / 14
Wouldn't hurt to improve the clarity of whether a base Bard skin Shrine in a bush is charged or not too. Elderwood Shrines are easy to see, but not so much the base ones.
I've always thought of building ap and strategically placing shrines, but even Cait traps seem easier to spot.
Can you guys PLEASE make it where Bard's ult completes casting once it leaves him? It's so frustrating to die when it's mid flight and it doesn't land.

We'll get some clean up on how Bard ult acts when Bard dies into patch 5.18. The intended behavior is that, if Bard dies before the missile gets fired, the ult immediately stops. If he dies after the missile's fired the ult continues. What's happening at the moment though is that Bard dying during the cast time results in no missile being fired, but the warning indicator (which is created at start of cast) remaining on the ground the whole duration. That makes it unclear for everyone what's going on, so we'll clean that up.
Sweet! Thank you so much! :D

While a mana cost reduction is nice, Bard's Shrines have a practicality issue in team fights: they will NEVER reach full strength before someone dies.

How about making them charge up faster with each point you put into Tempered Fate? Has this been tested?

As someone who loves to pull out Bard whenever I can pretend it makes sense, this change is one I'm strongly against. Making him a powerful teamfight healer would flatten out his areas of power, and right now he has very clear strengths/weaknesses that allow him to be balanced as a strong niche pick. Giving him more situations in which to shine sounds nice, but in the end would mean taking away his raw potential.

Thanks for the bit of info, Medley. Those are still early-mid game changes which do not sustain the ability's usage post laning, though they are decent improvements to at least assist the laning phase. Is the goal to just hope that the laning improvement is enough to assist the leveling of your adc and jungler to carry through the rest of the game?

When I play Bard, the only way to have him be useful is to build as a tank, so that W is not receiving an AP boost to the amount healed (which is usually insignificant either way because of the prevalence of the W as an emergency last-hope all-my-other-things-are-on-cooldown ability in the late game). It's never at a point where it compares to other heals.

Personally, I wish it had a stat-boost passive or lowered charge time as compensation for the drop-off. While I always start with W, I have no reason to put another point in it until every other ability has been maxed. 

He's so fun, but I feel like there are possibilities of removing that awkwardness and making him less hated by his teams.
Charge up time from 10/9/8/7/6 seconds would help more and just keep it at a flat 100 mana.
Wouldn't it be just a good idea to give his W a bonus health scaling?

I also like bard and would want to play him more, but honestly i think his Q is a little wacky the way a target is stunned, the hit box is so wide even when you're not standing behind anything or infront of a wall it latches on diagonally and that is so annoying, because you assume you're in the clear and then you get screwed.
pls no he is almost better than thresh lcs wise
What if the speed boost duration increased with rank? That way it has a good use outside of lane/healing. Something like 1 / 1.25 / 1.5 / 1.75 / 2?
The speed boost from it is still very strong, I always feel like its useful still late game.  His passive is also amazing in team fights so it rounds him out pretty well.

I'm not saying I don't use it as often as possible for that lil' speed boost, but that it's rather unspectacular. 

Example: there will be a Darius set up for dunking, but he is just the tiniest bit slower than the prey he is chasing.

The thing is, those situations are few (at least the ones we are present for), and our lil' Bard's W speed is not always enough to do what we hope it will do. When I want my team to endlessly chase down the enemy, I grab Zilean and follow Olaf to victory.

It doesn't need to be spectacular?

The speed boost + Heal is a godsend for lane and late game when you need to help an ADC kite or get some distance from the enemy, or throwing it on any team mate close to death from a DOT effect, or giving your Nautilus or other tank a little boost to pin someone.
It pretty much falls off after level 1. It's the last ability you max since it's worthless.

Each allied and/or enemy champion nearby reduces the time it takes for shrines to reach their full charge by 1 second  and 0.5 seconds respectively. 

4 allies = 4 seconds 
5 enemies = 2.5 seconds
= 6.5 seconds cut off the 10 second charge. 

Shrines are now much more useful in team fights.
Considering it's a heal that you don't need the support to be nearby to use, probably not.
